newsitem.title: UK: Daily Mail to offer 10.2 mln shares.
newsitem.headline: Daily Mail to offer 10.2 mln shares.

text.p: Daily Mail and General Trust DMGO) said on Monday it is offering up to 10.2 million shares ordinary non-voting shares following the purchase of Ratio Holdings Ltd.
Ratio owns 10.2 million shares ordinary non-voting shares, representing 10.8 percent of the DMGT's 'A' ordinary non-voting share capital.
UBS has agreed to buy Ratio, which is a holding company registered in Jersey, and will offer the shares to institutional investors.
DMGT, which publishes the national daily newspaper The Daily Mail, expects the offer price and the exact number of shares to be sold will be announced on March 7.
The company also said that trading has been satisfactory since the start of the year and plans to publish half year results on June 12.
It said that circulation of national titles at its unit Associated Newspapers continues to be buoyant despite price cutting by competitors.
UBS and Cazenove are joint lead managers on the share issue, while Robert Fleming and Schroders are acting as co lead. UBS is also acting as bookrunner.
